page.title: 19A Town School visits Gayton
page.content: We go to Eastfield Lower School in Northampton and we are all 9 years old. We were asked to do a survey of Gayton for "The Domesday Project" - none of us had ever been to Gayton and some hadn't even been to a village before. Here are some of the things we thought before we visited Gayton. "I think millionaires live in villages because they are rich." "There'll be a lot more nature there." "There won't be many shops to buy things in - so people will be richer." "It will be very quiet - because there won't be many cars." "Everybody will be old, the houses will be old too." "I can't wait to see the school, there are only 20 children in the school and we've got 30 in our class and they've got a computer all to themselves - it's not fair,"
